description: Retrieves the list of all policies in an organization of a specified type. This operation can be called only from the organization's management account or by a member account that is a delegated administrator.

parameters.name: Filter
parameters.description: Specifies the type of policy that you want to include in the response. You must specify one of the following values: SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY RESOURCE_CONTROL_POLICY DECLARATIVE_POLICY_EC2 BACKUP_POLICY TAG_POLICY CHATBOT_POLICY AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY SECURITYHUB_POLICY.

nested_items.name: Policies
nested_items.description: A list of policies that match the filter criteria in the request. The output list doesn't include the policy contents. To see the content for a policy, see  DescribePolicy.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The unique identifier (ID) of the policy.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the policy.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The friendly name of the policy.

nested_items.name: AwsManaged
nested_items.description: A boolean value that indicates whether the specified policy is an Amazon Web Services managed policy. If true, then you can attach the policy to roots, OUs, or accounts, but you cannot edit it.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: If present, indicates that more output is available than is included in the current response. Use this value in the NextToken request parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the next part of the output. You should repeat this until the NextToken response element comes back as null.
